Package fsm

Class Transition

  • java.lang.Object
    • fsm.Transition
  • public class Transition
extends java.lang.Object
    A class used to represent transitions in and FSM. A transition is defined by a name, source and target states, an associated event that fire the transition and a list of actions to be executed when the transition is fired
    Version:
    0.1
    Author:
    Arthur Depasse
    See Also:
    FSMServer

        See Also:

      • registerAction

        public void registerAction​(Action action)
        A function to register actions to launch when the transition is fired. Action are fired in the order they are added.
        Parameters:
        action - an action to add to the list of actions.
        See Also:
        actions

      • registerGuard

        public void registerGuard​(Guard g)
        A function to register a Guard object associated with this action.
        Parameters:
        g - the guard to register
        See Also:
        guard

      • processEvent

        public void processEvent​(Event event)
        A function called by State.processEvent(Event). It checks if the passed event match its one, then if the guard, if present, is verified. If so, it fires the transition, executing its actions and changing the current state of the FSM. Else, it does nothing.
        Parameters:
        event - the event to which the transition must or must not react.

      • getName

        public java.lang.String getName()
        A getter to get the name of the transition.
        Returns:
        the name of the transition.
        See Also:
        name
